definitions.definition: a person who has been tricked

examples.text: They were the victims of a cruel hoax.
The site offers help and advice for anyone who has been the victim of a scam.
ways to avoid becoming a victim of fraud
She defrauded her unsuspecting victims of millions of pounds.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that is badly affected by a situation, a decision, etc.

examples.text: Schools are the latest victims of cuts in public spending.
The small company became **a victim of its own success **when it could not supply all its orders on time.

definitions.definition: an animal or a person that is killed and offered as a sacrifice

examples.text: a sacrificial victim

phrases: a victim of your/​its own success

definitions.definition: to be injured, cheated, damaged or killed by somebody/something

examples.text: Many plants have fallen victim to the sudden frost.
Her son fell victim to tuberculosis.
Unfortunately, she fell victim to an unscrupulous landlord.

wordOrigin: late 15th cent. (denoting a creature killed as a religious sacrifice): from Latin victima.
